intro: Onagra grandiflora, commonly known as false flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Onagra grandiflora is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
